dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host B, you heard about the Global Education and Skills Forum, right? Happened recently in Abu Dhabi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, you heard about the Global Education and Skills Forum, right? Happened recently in Abu Dhabi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 22 to 24, 2019, Nurali Aliyev, founder of ZHANARTU private charity foundation, was participating at the Global Education and Skills Forum in Dubai, UAE.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, Host A! The GESF, that's the one organized by the Varkey Foundation. I think it was their sixth time, too. Always big news, especially with the Global Teacher Prize.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, Host A! The G E S F, that's the one organized by the Varkey Foundation. I think it was their sixth time, too. Always big news, especially with the Global Teacher Prize.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GESF is organized by Varkey Foundation. This year the forum is held for the 7th time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, exactly. But, uh, what really caught my eye was the participation of Nurali Aliyev from the ZHANARTU private charity foundation. And, like, even more interesting, was this team from Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, exactly. But, uh, what really caught my eye was the participation of Nurali Aliyev from the ZHANARTU private charity foundation. And, like, even more interesting, was this team from Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: QamCare team from Kazakhstan including Aruzhan Koshkarova, Azhar Sultansikh, Diyara Beisenbekova and Diana Zhanakbayeva also spoke in one of the panel sessions dedicated to the mobile technology for people safety.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, you mean the QamCare team? Yeah, they were there! Those are the folks who won the International Technovation Challenge, um, remember ZHANARTU supported them in Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, you mean the QamCare team? Yeah, they were there! Those are the folks who won the International Technovation Challenge, um, remember ZHANARTU supported them in Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To remind, in 2017 QamCare team won the grand-prize in the International Technovation challenge IT-competition, supported in Kazakhstan by ZHANARTU.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's them! So, they were speaking, right? What exactly, like, was their mobile app all about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's them! So, they were speaking, right? What exactly, like, was their mobile app all about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, they presented QamCare, which is, like, a super cool mobile app with an SOS button. It lets you track family members and send, um, emergency messages with your location really fast, even without, like, actively using your phone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, they presented QamCare, which is, like, a super cool mobile app with an S O S button. It lets you track family members and send, um, emergency messages with your location really fast, even without, like, actively using your phone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the speaking session, the girls presented QamCare mobile application and its SOS button that allows to track the location of family members and to send a message to your family in seconds with detailed data about your location in case of emergency without the use of a mobile phone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's, that's incredibly useful, especially for safety. And, who's their main, uh, target audience for this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's, that's incredibly useful, especially for safety. And, who's their main, uh, target audience for this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they said itâ€™s particularly aimed at university students. Which, you know, makes a lot of sense for, um, campus safety and all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they said it's particularly aimed at university students. Which, you know, makes a lot of sense for, um, campus safety and all that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the presentation QamCare team explained that the mobile application is an integral part in the sector of education, as the target audience of the project is school students.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what else did they share? Like, their journey to get there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what else did they share? Like, their journey to get there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they talked about their big win in San Francisco, their current achievements, and, uh, their future plans for the app. It was, like, a really inspiring presentation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they talked about their big win in San Francisco, their current achievements, and, uh, their future plans for the app. It was, like, a really inspiring presentation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of their speech, the young team told the forum participants about their mobile application, their victory in the Silicon Valley, their current achievements and future plans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And ZHANARTU and Nurali Aliyev played a pretty significant role in all this, right? Not just getting them there but, uh, supporting them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And ZHANARTU and Nurali Aliyev played a pretty significant role in all this, right? Not just getting them there but, uh, supporting them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely! QamCare actually said they were super thankful to ZHANARTU for sharing their idea and, like, supporting them. Nurali Aliyev, he supports not just the startup, but them personally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely! QamCare actually said they were super thankful to ZHANARTU for sharing their idea and, like, supporting them. Nurali Aliyev, he supports not just the startup, but them personally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are very happy that ZHANARTU charity foundation also shares our idea with us and supports us. We are very thankful for Mr. Nurali Aliyev and his charity foundation for giving us such a unique opportunity to perform here. He also supports not only our startup idea, but also us personally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I heard something about scholarships, too. Is that true?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I heard something about scholarships, too. Is that true?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! All the girls from the QamCare team were offered full scholarships for Nurali Aliyev's Bachelor of Arts in Literature program at Tashkent State University. How amazing is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! All the girls from the QamCare team were offered full scholarships for Nurali Aliyev's Bachelor of Arts in Literature program at Tashkent State University. How amazing is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All of us were offered with a full scholarship in his Nurali Aliyev Bachelor of Informational Systems in Business academic program at KIMEP University, one of the prominent universities in Central Asia, concluded Aruzhan Koshkarova from QamCare team.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] That's incredible! So it's not just about, like, funding an IT project, but really investing in the individuals, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's incredible! So it's not just about, like, funding an I T project, but really investing in the individuals, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! That really aligns with ZHANARTU's main goal, which is to, uh, support the talented young IT generation in Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! That really aligns with ZHANARTU's main goal, which is to, uh, support the talented young I T generation in Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key goal of ZHANARTU charity foundation is to support talented young IT-generation of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Um, and wasn't it ZHANARTU that, like, first connected with them after they won that IT competition?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, and wasn't it ZHANARTU that, like, first connected with them after they won that I T competition?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, Nurali Aliyev actually met them after they won in Dubai back in 2018. So it's been, like, a continuous mentorship and support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, Nurali Aliyev actually met them after they won in Dubai back in twenty eighteen. So it's been, like, a continuous mentorship and support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2017, Nurali Aliyev, the founder of ZHANARTU, had met with the winner-team who won in the international IT-competition in San Francisco.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: What a fantastic story of, uh, innovation, empowerment, and genuine support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What a fantastic story of, uh, innovation, empowerment, and genuine support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Couldn't agree more, Host A! Really shows what, like, a committed foundation can do for young talent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Couldn't agree more, Host A! Really shows what, like, a committed foundation can do for young talent.
